metadata.subject: Sieyès, Emmanuel Joseph, comte, 1748-1836
Sieyès, Emmanuel Joseph, comte, 1748-1836
Freedom of the press
metadata.title: Adressé a l'abbé Sÿes : de ce pretre, craignés l'air fin et seducteur, l[']imposteur est caché, sous son masque hypocrite, la vérité jamais ne pénétra son cœur, Francais il vous trompa, voila tout son merite
metadata.description: Picture caption: Ne me trahis pas, ou je-- ?

Subject: Sieyès is seated in a church with a nude woman holding a torch on his lap. He reads from a book on which is written the phrase "Ch. de la vérité." Two pillows with the phrases "Ch. de Paris" and "Ch. de Montpellier" lie beneath the woman on a table. Beneath the caption is text excoriating Sieyès for motions regarding freedom of the press that he presented to the Assemblée nationale
metadata.notes: Title page located on front cover. No copyright page found. No table-of-contents pages found. Worn, damaged and discolored pages and cover. Skewed text. Uneven binding.
